title: Flipped Learning-Based Self-Regulated Learning Strategy Utilization in Math MOOC Design

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics computational skills and experience using online learning tools
context.additional_context: Conducted in classroom environments using digital devices (tablets/laptops), combining flipped learning with self-regulated learning (SRL) strategies in a blended model. Monitors individual learning patterns through learning analytics (LA) techniques

learning_goals: Learners complete 80% or more of online videos (8 sessions, ~15 minutes each) and offline activities (2 projects) in a flipped learning environment over four weeks to assess self-regulated learning competencies

Learners identify their learning patterns (4 types: content navigation/assessment orientation, etc.) via learning analytics (LA) tools and document improvement plans three or more times in weekly reflection journals

Learners will select three real-life mathematical problems in a 2-week team project (3–4 members per group), develop a portfolio documenting the problem-solving process (including problem definition, mathematical modeling, solution methods, and result analysis), and submit the final output after achieving a score of 4 or higher on a 5-point peer evaluation rubric (clarity, creativity, collaboration).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
